thread.title: Prep Roundup: Broadneck's Niumatalolo commits to Boise State
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup: Broadneck's Niumatalolo commits to Boise State

title: Prep Roundup: Broadneck's Niumatalolo commits to Boise State
text:
Prep Roundup: Broadneck's Niumatalolo commits to Boise State Broadneck defeats Glen Burnie By Paul W. Gillespie / Capital Gazette 
Broadneck's Ali'i Niumatalolo plays tight end in first quarter. The Broadneck Bruins defeated the visiting Glen Burnie Gophers, 41-20, in high school football Saturday afternoon. Niumatalolo committed to play at Boise State on Tuesday. 
Broadneck's Ali'i Niumatalolo plays tight end in first quarter. The Broadneck Bruins defeated the visiting Glen Burnie Gophers, 41-20, in high school football Saturday afternoon. Niumatalolo committed to play at Boise State on Tuesday. (By Paul W. Gillespie / Capital Gazette) 
Broadneck senior linebacker Ali’i Niumatalolo has verbally committed to Boise State of the Mountain West Conference. Niumatalolo, the son of Navy coach Ken Niumatalolo, had seven tackles and also caught a pair of passes in Saturday’s 41-20 victory over Glen Burnie that improved the Bruins to 6-1 ahead of a huge matchup with Old Mill on Friday.Niumatalolo, who announced the commitment via Twitter Tuesday night, also had offers from Bowling Green, Buffalo, Connecticut, Marshall and Miami (Ohio). 
Volleyball 
AACS 3, GLENELG 0: Morgan Lang had 20 assists while Grace Williamson added 19 digs as Annapolis Area Christian School's volleyball team clinched the top seed in IAAM C Conference play, winning in straight sets, 25-10, 25-15, 25-13, over Glenelg Country School on Tuesday. 
Sophie Thompson went 17 for 17 serving with four blocks and four kills while Mia Hardesty went 13 for 15 serving with five kills for AACS (11-4). 
SOUTHERN 3, MEADE 0: The Bulldogs won their 11th straight match, 25-16, 25-9, 25-14, behind the play of Raven Pratt (nine kills), Gracie Judge (16 assists, five aces), Adair Watson (six kills, six aces), and Grace Howl (four kills, two blocks). Southern improved to 11-2, while Meade fell to 2-7.
